steps.title: Cut a piece of the muslin large enough for your selected design.
steps.content: Cut a piece of the muslin large enough for your selected design.

steps.title: Lay the muslin on top of the pattern.
steps.content: Lay the muslin on top of the pattern.

steps.title: Lightly trace the pattern onto your muslin.
steps.content: Lightly trace the pattern onto your muslin. A light box can make this faster and easier.

steps.title: Pin the fabric to the pattern to keep it from sliding as you trace.
steps.content: Pin the fabric to the pattern to keep it from sliding as you trace.

steps.title: Use a washable marker to make small dots to indicate the placement of the colonial knots and any other embroidery stitches used in the design.
steps.content: Use a washable marker to make small dots to indicate the placement of the colonial knots and any other embroidery stitches used in the design.

steps.title: Check to be certain that you have transferred the entire Candlewicking pattern to the muslin and haven't missed anything.
steps.content: Check to be certain that you have transferred the entire Candlewicking pattern to the muslin and haven't missed anything.

steps.title: Remove the pins and set the pattern aside.
steps.content: Remove the pins and set the pattern aside.

steps.title: Place the fabric in an embroidery hoop.
steps.content: Place the fabric in an embroidery hoop.

steps.title: Thread the embroidery needle with 4 strands of Candlewicking thread or 6-12 strands of embroidery floss.
steps.content: Thread the embroidery needle with 4 strands of Candlewicking thread or 6-12 strands of embroidery floss. The amount of floss you use will determine how large your colonial knots will be. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tie a knot in the thread or floss and stitch your first colonial knot.
steps.content: Tie a knot in the thread or floss and stitch your first colonial knot. If this is your first Candlewicking design, practice making colonial knots on a small piece of muslin before you begin.

steps.title: Systematically work the design - left to right, top to bottom, or whatever to prevent soiling finished areas.
steps.content: Systematically work the design - left to right, top to bottom, or whatever to prevent soiling finished areas. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Launder when finished to remove the marker.
steps.content: Launder when finished to remove the marker.

steps.title: Size the finished piece by laying the piece face down on a clean, prewashed white towel and iron it from the back.
steps.content: Size the finished piece by laying the piece face down on a clean, prewashed white towel and iron it from the back.

steps.title: "Pat" the fabric with the iron when ironing to avoid damaging the colonial knots.
steps.content: "Pat" the fabric with the iron when ironing to avoid damaging the colonial knots.
